intro: Stenogyne adpressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in coastal and wet forest habitats, often in rocky or shaded areas. Stenogyne adpressa is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the region.
